Key Arguments: The Australian government engaged in clandestine censorship of social media posts during the Covid-19 pandemic, targeting legitimate content.
Many posts that were censored contained valid information or well-reasoned perspectives challenging Covid-19 countermeasures.
The government's actions contradict claims of targeting misinformation, as some censored content is now acknowledged as plausible by intelligence agencies.
The censorship operations set a dangerous precedent for freedom of speech and dissent in the digital age.
The proposed Misinformation Bill threatens further encroachment on free speech with hefty penalties for platforms.
Notable Quotes: It’s gravely concerning for all Australians who care about freedom of speech.
It’s never been more imperative that we protect freedom of speech in Australia and reject this bill.
Censorship operations actively curtailed posts with views counter to the government's position, creating a dangerous precedent for dissent in the digital age.
